answers.answer: Although I cannot make an accurate diagnosis without personally examining you or reviewing your films, I tend to agree with your neurologist that your symptoms don't sound like ALS, MS or PD. With the history of the tick bite, I am concerned about all the possible tick-borne diseases which include LYme, Rocky Mt spotted fever, and ehrlichiosis, as well as others. I would consider getting a spinal tap to rule out a chronic meningitis picture that you could get with Lyme dz or other infections that are not picked up with blood work. Also, think about getting an infectious disease expert to take a look at you.Had you not had the tick bite, other things to consider would be new onset of diabetes or primary muscle problems. The diabetes could be ruled out with a glucose tolerance test or special blood studies. The muscle disorders could be evaluated with an EMG and possibly a muscle biopsy.I'm glad that all your studies have been normal so far. But I am concerned that you're losing weight and having on-going symptoms. It sounds like there's an infectious component to this. Talk to your docs about a spinal tap and getting an ID consult. Best of luck to you.

question: I am a 32 year old male and for the last 2 months I have been having muscle pain(back of thighs), tightness, twitching in legs arms and face, slight cramping, slight numbness in hands for a week with pain up arms, fatigue, hot flashes, can't sleep good(keep waking up and seem to be very thirsty) and I am now loosing a lot of weight. I have no muscle weakness(the weight loss seems to be loss of fat and I don't have much to spare)but do have a slight loss of coordination when grabbing things and walking(it is like my arms and legs are heavy). I had a CT and MRI and all kinds of blood work. Everything is normal including CPK,B12,thryiod and Lyme. Neurological exam was great, all reflexs good and no tounge flacalations.Two months ago I had a thorn in my little finger that became infected and had a red line going up my arm. 10 days of Keflex took care of that.  I felt good for almost a week and then found a blood engorged tick on my leg.  About a week later I started feeling pain that started in the arm that had the infection  Dr. put me on Doxycycline for 14 days.  The first night I took it I awoke a few hours later shaking like I had a fever but no tempature. That went away in about a half hour.  Over he next three weeks this happened 2 other times.  I would bundle up with a lot of blankets even though I was not cold and go back to sleep.  The Neurologist says that I don't have ALS(I hope not) and probably not MS or Parkinsons. One Doctor thought I might have had Ehrlichiosis and this was the after effects.  Everyone is stumped.Any thoughts would be appreciated.
title: Doctor is stumped
